We repeated analyses of trends and outcomes for causes of cirrhosis after restricting the NASH definition. This definition of NASH was based on the presence of a NASH diagnostic code or the presence of metabolic syndrome without an alternative cause of cirrhosis. Metabolic syndrome was defined according to guidelines established by the National Cholesterol Education Program Adult Treatment Panel III,
23 according to the presence of at least 3 of the following factors: obesity, dyslipidemia, hypertension, and impaired fasting glucose or diabetes, with corresponding diagnostic codes.
